website_summaries.verdict: The minimalist design of the Bare-XF 210 v2 was well received by the training community. The close-to-the-ground profile and roomy toe box were both much appreciated by the weight training enthusiasts. On the downside, there were complaints about the insole sliding around. But overall, it was still the shoe of choice for many fitness aficionados because of the grippy outsole and the protective rubber panel.
pros: A majority of testers liked the minimalist design of the Inov-8 Bare-XF 210 v2
Being close to the ground, many users stated that it made it easier to perform lifts
A few people mentioned that they appreciated the wide toe box as it promotes toe splaying
Gym enthusiasts stated that the shoe’s flexibility made it great for CrossFit
Several purchasers mentioned that the trainer offered good traction because of the sticky sole
The improved Rope-Tec on the side panels of the shoe was lauded by most consumers
Many of the owners mentioned that they liked the lightweight nature of the footwear
cons: Multiple users reported that the removable insoles kept sliding off and bunching up inside the shoe
Some of them resorted to gluing the inserts down

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe feels great. I’m a size 12 and the size 12 I ordered fits perfect. I went for a aggressive bike ride the day I get them and had no problems. I’m not going to cross train in them so I won’t be able to see how durable they are in that respect. Having said that they do have a sturdy feel to them. I’ve seen other reviews that say they are uncomfortable but I don’t feel that way at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel P.

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and great look.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit true to size, I bought size 8-1/2 which is what I normally buy and I'm happy with the fit. I really like the feel of the shoe, it has the feel of a toe shoe without the odd looks or hassle of putting them on. I've only had them for about a month so I can't say anything about durability but they seem to be well made and I expect them to last a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An odd shoe, but it has it's uses.
customer_reviews.text: I did not know what to expect with this shoe. The sole is extremely thin, very light weight. I am an ogre size person, 6'3" 250lbs. These shoes are terrible for walking, and I would never run in these. However, these are spectacular for weightlifting!! Way better than my actual weightlifting shoes. The are basically a low cut wrestling or boxing shoe. Anyway hope that helps. I will definitely buy these again, but only for this very specific use. I'm sure normal size people would have a different opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: NOT the shoe for martial arts or any fast footwork.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is NOT good for fast sudden movement. I purchased for martial arts and right away the sole pads inside the shoe shifted around. Shoe looks good but not ideal for my purpose. Any sort of footwork drills or speed training the sole pad inside will move! Please look elsewhere for your shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard sole, uncomfortable, useless
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to understand how anyone could make such a light weight minimalist shoe this uncomfortable. The sole is far too rigid which is uncomfortable to wear and entirely useless for some exercise movements. The overall shape of the shoe bares little resemblance to the human foot. Perhaps this shoe would better suit a goat or larger ungulate. FEEBLE. Thanks for nothing Inov-8
customer_reviews.author: murray

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor calisthenics
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have been great. I bought them because I started doing calisthenics at home after my gym closed due to COVID, and I found my running shoes to be too bulky. These feel like bare feet, but offer just enough protection to train on pavement. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Colin Kelley

customer_reviews.title: The perfect shoe doesn't exi.......
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe!! Everything about it. They look neat, not too minimal to make you look weird wearing them out of the gym. Breathable, which is very much needed in the Arizona heat!! Just enough cushion so when you stomp your feet getting hype it feels great!! Only possible drawback is the sole bends, but that's just because it's so thin and making it thicker would take away from the minimal feel.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Llamas

customer_reviews.title: best “barefoot” shoes I have tried
customer_reviews.text: extremely comfortable, closest shoes to actually being barefoot that i have tried, durable, well made
customer_reviews.author: Michael Crehan

customer_reviews.title: Style and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very light. Fits my feet well, like not wearing anything. It's comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: joseph aspiras

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my brother who is very active. He loved them!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Inov continues to impress!
customer_reviews.text: Quality minimalist shoe that provides good grip on the gym floor or leg press machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: I like them!
customer_reviews.text: I wear Merrell Trail Glove 4's but they have sadly been discontinued and replaced by the crappy 5's. I came across this shoe and gave it a try. These aren't as "grippy" as the trail glove for obvious reasons but they are pretty good around town barefoot shoes. My only complaint is they are a little tight in the toe box and I have fairly narrow feet, so if you have wider feet I'd stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndy Long-Pace

product_meta.title: inov-8 Men's Bare-XF 210 Cross Trainer
product_meta.description: The BARE-XF 210 V2 is the most stripped-back shoe in the range, bringing the foot closer to the ground. Offering a natural fit and improved Rope-Tec protection, this shoe delivers superb grip and durability on ropes. Comes with 3mm and 6mm POWER FOOTBEDS allowing you to fine tune your fit and underfoot cushioning.
feature_bullets: Breathable - Mesh upper provides ventilation to keep your feet cool, dry and comfortable.
Moisture Management - Wicks away sweat from your feet to keep you dry and comfortable.
Toe Splay - Ensures freedom of movement in all directions
Meta-Flex Technology - Allows natural flexing in the forefoot.
Adapterweb Cradle Lacing System - Keeps the feet secure in the shoe.
